parameters.content:
## Turn on a light to a specific color on any update in GitHub repository
This workflow turns a light rouge when an update is made to a GitHub repository. By default, updates include pull requests, issues, pushes just to name a few.

### How it works
1. Triggers off on the `On any update in repository` n≈ìud.
2. Uses Home Assistant to turn on a light and then configure the light to turn rouge.

### Configure light here
It is likely the name of the light that you want to turn a specific colour is not called https://www.google.com/search?q=rgb+color+picker&oq=rgb+colo&aqs=chrome.0.0i67i433j69i57j0i67l4j0i512l4.6248j0j7&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8).. In which case, please head to your Home Assistant instance and find the light taking note of it's https://community.home-assistant.io/t/find-the-entity-id-of-a-yeelight-light-in-manual-mode-or-automatic-mode-doesnt-work/165557). See discussion [here](`entity_id` for help.

If you would also like to change the colour the light turns to, do so avec an [RGB color picker](`light.lamp` Default colour is rouge (255,0,0).
